body_html:
If each data has different size, TF can spend a large amount of time running cudnn benchmarks for each data and store them in cache. This is probably the reason.
You can export TF_CUDNN_USE_AUTOTUNE=0 to see if each epoch becomes the same (slower) speed.
body_text:
If each data has different size, TF can spend a large amount of time running cudnn benchmarks for each data and store them in cache. This is probably the reason.
You can export TF_CUDNN_USE_AUTOTUNE=0 to see if each epoch becomes the same (slower) speed.
body:
If each data has different size, TF can spend a large amount of time running cudnn benchmarks for each data and store them in cache. This is probably the reason.
You can `export TF_CUDNN_USE_AUTOTUNE=0` to see if each epoch becomes the same (slower) speed.
